name: Recorded Future For Splunk SOAR
description: This app implements investigative actions to perform lookups for quick reputation information, contextual threat intelligence and external threat alerts

on_poll_alert_ruleids.description: Comma-separated list of alert rule IDs

on_poll_alert_severity.description: Severity to apply to the alert event

on_poll_playbook_alert_priority.description: Comma separated On Poll Playbook Alerts priority threshold (High,Moderate,Informational)

on_poll_playbook_alert_type.description: Comma-separated list of Playbook alert types. (domain_abuse, cyber_vulnerability, code_repo_leakage are now supported)

on_poll_playbook_alert_start_time.description: Poll playbook alerts created after (date in ISO format: 2022-12-01T11:00:00+00)

max_count.description: Max events to ingest for scheduled polling

first_max_count.description: Max events to ingest for scheduled polling first time

actions.description: Search for links data

entity_id.description: Entity ID (Do not specify ID when use 'name'+'type')

entity_name.description: Entity name (can be used only with selected type)

source_type.description: Sources are grouped into two types, technical analysis and Insikt Group research. Specify either technical or insikt for the type

timeframe.description: Time range for when rules were triggered

technical_type.description: Technical link sources may be further filtered by specifying an event type (type:MalwareAnalysis)

actions.description: Search for detection rule

entity_id.description: Entity ID (Do not specify ID when use 'name'+'type')

entity_name.description: Entity name (can be used only with selected type)

rule_types.description: This is a comma separated list of the following values: 'yara', 'sigma', and 'snort'.  Values in this filter are applied as a logical 'OR'

title.description: Free text search for Insikt notes associated with detection rules

example_values: Insikt Validated TTP: Hunting Brute Ratel C4
Brute Ratel C4 (BRc4) is a red team tool authored by security researcher....

actions.description: Get threat actor intelligence

country location for the threat actor

actions.description: Enables contribute data, `collective insights`, into the Recorded Future Intelligence Cloud

entity_name.description: Entity value of the IOC itself

entity_type.description: Entity Type value that can contain one of the enumerated list of values: ip, hash, domain, vulnerability, url

entity_field.description: Entity field used to describe characteristics about the IOC. Example: dstip

entity_source_type.description: Used to describe what log source the IOC came from.  Example: netscreen:firewall

event_name.description: Title of the event related to the IOC. Example: Recorded Future Domain Abuse Alert

event_type.description: Attack vector associated with the incident. Example: C2, Phishing, splunk-detection-rule, ... etc)

mitre_codes.description: Comma-separated list of MITRE codes associated with the IOC. Example: T1055, T1064

malware.description: Comma separated Malware associated with the IOCs. Example: Stuxnet, DUQU

actions.description: Ingest alerts from Recorded Future
actions.verbose: This action will fetch alerts / Playbook Alerts for the specified rule IDs and within the specified timeframe. When limiting the number of events to ingest, it will ingest the most recent events.

container_count.description: Maximum number of events to query for
